full_summary:
**Government Tender Announcement**
==========================

### Title

NRCan-5000070979-Gas Pycnometer

### Reference Number

PW-22-01014926

### Solicitation Number

NRCan-5000070979

### Publication Date

December 1, 2022

### Tender Closing Date

January 10, 2023, at 2:00 PM EST

### Amendment Number

1

### Amendment Date

December 22, 2022

### Procurement Category

Goods and Services (GD)

### Notice Type

Request for Proposal (RFP)

### Procurement Method

Competitive - Limited Tendering

### Trade Agreements

Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

### Regions of Opportunity

National Capital Region (NCR)

### Contact Information

Natural Resources Canada
580 Booth St, Ottawa, ON K1A 0E4, Canada
Vincent Gariepy, vincent.gariepy@nrcan-rncan.gc.ca
Phone: None
Fax: None

### Tender Description

Natural Resources Canada invites proposals to acquire one (1) Gas Pycnometer, including a multi-volume kit for characterizing 14 mm diameter pellets and powder samples weigh- ing less than 1g. The successful bidder must deliver the equipment to the designated location in Ontario, Canada, based on the DDP (Delivered Duty Paid) Incoterms 2020 terms.

The proposed procurement is subject to the Trade Agreement and will follow the competitive limited tendering process. The selected supplier will be required to provide the equipment, meet the specified requirements, and adhere to the delivery terms outlined in the tender package.

The tender package is available for download from the Government of Canada's Buy and Sell portal: [link](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/12/01/bc2f421ff522c1bbf69b483bd9e9025f/notice_of_proposed_procurement-nrcan-5000070979-gas_pycnometer.pdf)

Submission guidelines and proposal instructions are outlined in the tender package. Proposals must be submitted electronically by 2:00 PM EST on January 10, 2023. Late submissions will not be accepted.

Respondents are responsible for ensuring that their proposals are submitted in the required format and meet all the specified requirements. Natural Resources Canada reserves the right to waive minor evaluation or non-compliance issues, but may disqualify unacceptable submissions
